𓃘 ⇔ Sumerian kungas, hybrids of domesticated donkeys and Syrian wild asses. War donkeys

https://www.guardianmag.press/2022/01/hybrid-animal-in-4500-year-old-tomb-is-earliest-known-bred-by-humans.html/
kungas highly prized and very expensive beasts, which could be explained by the rather difficult process of breeding them

Kungas are mentioned in several ancient texts in cuneiform on clay tablets from Mesopotamia, and they are portrayed drawing four-wheeled war wagons on the famous “Standard of Ur,” a Sumerian mosaic from about 4,500 years ago

The Syrian wild ass species had become much smaller in recent times than it had been in antiquity, probably due to environmental pressures such as hunting; it is now extinct.

𓃘 kunga > hungar > onager
𓃘 hemippe hemi - hippo (half horse)
𓃘 achdari
